title: Putting It All Together
content:
Now it’s your turn to answer a scientific question by creating a representative color image and explaining what it reveals.

Think about these points before you begin:

  • What would you like to investigate? What question do you want to answer?
      Here are some options:
    • Look through a dusty nebula to see what’s inside
    • Search for a faraway galaxy
    • Locate the hot young stars in a galaxy
    • Identify star-forming regions in a galaxy
  • What filters will be most appropriate for conducting your investigation? Why? (Note: you must use at least two filters.)
  • Develop your chromatic ordering sequence.

To get started:

  • Use the Astronomical Color Mixing Tool to select an object from the list.
  • For each of the filters you wish to use, start by turning on each filter and selecting colors.
  • Adjust the sliders to enhance the image. Think about color-balancing the image so it clearly shows the areas or objects you wish to study.
  • If needed, you can open up additional windows to compare different filters or different objects in the same filter by clicking on the “add a window” sign in the upper right.
  • You may wish to use the drawing tool to mark a place on the image where you have identified an object, or where you wish to direct a comment.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: When you are done, save your completed image(s).

question.title: Question #1
question.label:
Along with your image, write a summary that includes:

  1. The type of object(s) you selected to explore
  2. The question you wanted to answer
  3. The filters and images you selected (and why)
  4. The chromatic order of colors you assigned
  5. What you did to create a color balanced image
  6. The procedure you followed to analyze the image(s)
  7. What you learned through this process (What was the answer to the question you posed?)
  8. What improvements would you make in a future investigation (e.g., different filters, different balance, etc.) to make the image more effective in communicating your results?
